page.title: 08GOODWOOD AIRFIELD SITE.
page.content: The site of what is now {Goodwood {Airfield and Motor Circuit }originally formed part of Woodcote Farm on the {Goodwood}Estate.At the outbreak of war in 1939 it was requisitioned by the Air Ministry for use as a satellite aerodrome for {R.A.F. Tangmere.} It was known as{Westhampnett Airfield. Spitfires & Typhoons were based here & flown by wartime heroes like{Douglas {Bader.} Following the war, plans were made to use the 2.4 mile long perimeter road as a motor racing track. The first race was held in{1948 and racing continued until it closed in{ 1966.}Famous drivers have raced here, including{Stirling Moss}and{Mike {Hawthorn.}In 1958 two aircraft landing strips for small aircraft were prepared in the centre of the circuit. This was the beginning of the airfield development which continues today.
